title: Inspect talents window
body:
The inspect talents window has a number of issues. This is about the talent window shown when inspecting other players. The one for your own talents works fine.

Many custom talents (including modified ones and new ones) are not shown properly, or at all. There are also some vanilla talents that have wrong tooltips.

I have fixed most, if not all of these issues locally, and you can see the changes here: https://github.com/cyaohiri/TurtleWoW-patches/commit/f6b70d0da5e5a7e93949d7845d307cc0d93e13a1

Another issue is that currently, the code makes a new line after each period. See https://github.com/cyaohiri/TurtleWoW-patches/blob/f6b70d0da5e5a7e93949d7845d307cc0d93e13a1/patch-3.mpq/Interface/FrameXML/Turtle_InspectTalentsUI/InspectTalentsFrame.lua#L2500
While this works in some cases, in many cases it's wrong and results in line splits where they don't belong, like after a decimal point.
See this as an example:
![image](https://github.com/slowtorta/turtlewow-bug-tracker/assets/86041826/44f2b0cc-c915-4903-bfe1-1bf90c342764)

A better solution would be to implement word-wrapping instead, but it has to maintain new lines that are present in the strings (after the previous modification), like in the case of the Master Demonologist talent that should look like this:
![image](https://github.com/slowtorta/turtlewow-bug-tracker/assets/86041826/217dd9d5-b75f-42ca-9d7e-a1320974ffbf)
Perhaps the same word-wrapping code as used in the talent calculator can be used here.

Yet another issue, probably unrelated to those above, is that the inspect talents window does not update on target change. Other tabs in the inspect window do update, but to update the talents window, one has to click on the character tab first, and then go back to the talents tab, which forces it to update.
To replicate this:
1 - Inspect another player and click on the  talents tab
2 - While the talents tab is open, click on another player
3 - The talents tab should update as other do, but doesn't
4 - To make it update, click on the character tab, then back to talents tab.

Another error that sometimes occurs when inspecting the talents of other players is that the talents windows triggers an error in Turtle_InspectTalentsUI/InspectTalentsFrame.lua:2505: attempt to index field `?' (a nil value), although it doesn't happen as much with my updates to the file, as it's probably triggered by talents that are originally missing.

A short clip to illustrate some of this:
https://streamable.com/imi3xz

In addition, sometimes the entire tree of the inspected player is showing question marks, as if the game can't find the icon to each talent. I've only seen this happen when inspecting players who are seemingly away. It almost never happens when inspecting players who are moving or have recently moved. 

Let me know if it's better to post this as separate issues. I'm posting it as one as they're all about the inspect talents window.

title: Alah'thalas missing Shady Dealer and proper signposting/guard dialogue, and further suggestions.
body:
**Please, provide a clear description what the bug is:**

I'm not sure this is a bug more than it is a glaring omission but I wasn't sure how else or where else to inform you of it. 

Alah'thalas, the High Elf capital equivalent , lacks a Shady Dealer (the NPCs that sell reagents for poisons). Given it has a rogue trainer, it seems reasonable to me that it should also have a Shady Dealer. Further, Alah'thalas needs better sign posting and ideally the ability to speak with guards there to be able to find your way around.

_**As a second, separate point, and the rest is more of a suggestion than an accusation of glaring omission. Alah'thalas could also do with the following:**_

An auctioneer.
A bank.
In general all the facilities a capital city offers.

I put these in more of a 'suggestion' tier because of the effective adjacency to Stormwind, but I think it's justified given Ironforges effective adjacency to Stormwind but also being fully stocked with these things.

**Steps to reproduce the behavior with as much detail as possible:**

1. Go to Alah'thalas
2. Mourn for better facilities there.
3. Weep.

**Expected behavior. Describe how it should work:**

Alah'thalas should have everything it logically should have, with the Shady Dealer and better signposting, and more of a suggestion: be a fully functioning capital city.

comments.body: We need to figure out if, as the vial proc consumes the charge, if it snapshots the proc for the entire dot duration. And, we need to see if refreshing the proc will continue the higher damage.

> We need to figure out if, as the vial proc consumes the charge, if it snapshots the proc for the entire dot duration. And, we need to see if refreshing the proc will continue the higher damage.

It does not seem to apply any bonus to the Vial proc, if that's what you're asking.  So it just eats the buff and grants no benefits.  Which would make sense, because the Vial proc doesn't seem to scale with SP, anyway.  Though, since all the nerfs it's had, it probably should scale with SP now.  Or, even letting it trigger "on cast" effects like WoC could give it some nice utility.  As it stands now, it's usefulness has been drawn into question.  But this is a different conversation.

% buffs like stormstrike, nightfall, curse of elements/shadow, these all have nothing to do with spellpower coefficient scaling. Even when spells have 0 coeff, they can be buffed by these +% magic buffs.

So yes, we will need testing here.
I already did test it with Stormstrike.  The Stormstrike buff does nothing for Vial and Vial just eats the buff.  That is why we are having this conversation.

I am able to test now:
![image](https://github.com/slowtorta/turtlewow-bug-tracker/assets/151180101/53d761b9-6b76-4b3a-99b2-41cde5b896b8)

Vial when it procs does eat stomstrike buffs, but stormstrike is acting like Nightfall and CoE/S in that while the buff exists, any damage ticks will be amplified. If stormstrike is used once two stacks are on the target, the existing dot gets buffed "for free", so the street goes both ways here.

![image](https://github.com/slowtorta/turtlewow-bug-tracker/assets/151180101/1abca55a-4354-4d51-be82-7c903d8d9db3)

Rouge's deadly poison works exactly the same.

This is a problem of blizzard's that is now exacerbated by a new TWoW item. I will convene with the staff about how/when we want to rectify this.
This will only potentially be addressed with class changes 2, no action will be taken before then.

![image](https://github.com/slowtorta/turtlewow-bug-tracker/assets/151180101/2bb9d2e3-d796-4702-834d-1102b2a74366)
![image](https://github.com/slowtorta/turtlewow-bug-tracker/assets/151180101/6bea62ef-0ba8-4704-8e19-05d394849eac)
Imp Shadowbolt + Corruption works exactly the same way as Stormstrike + Deadly Poison, when it comes to the dot not snapshotting.

Indeed the removal of Imp Shadowbolt stacks is not caused by Corruption, but this is backed up by the text saying Non-Periodic. Stormstrike does not have this text, and in gameplay this is reflected as deadly poison does consume charges.

Not sure why this was closed. This needs to be investigated more and shouldn't be disregarded without explanation.

The pipe does apply an aura called "stealth" after 3 seconds (of losing control of your character), but the "stealth" doesn't function like any other stealth aura in the game. The trinket states it places you into "stealth" and works during combat. The only other ability in the game that functions like that and has similar language is Vanish. This trinket should at least drop aggro from mobs, especially if used at long range / behind line of sight, or have its description changed. I can see the power of this trinket in PvP, but I am certain that thousands of gold pieces have been collectively wasted by PvE players due to this oversight.

This item is currently a gold trap for PvE players. I can't think of any reasonable justification for having an inaccurate description as an intended design. If it's clearer what the trinket actually does, there won't be a trap for future players to fall into, and resources won't be wasted on frustrated players asking to have their items refunded.

title: Brigade Footman only has a male human model
body:
The Brigade Footman NPC of the Gilneas Brigade, located in Ravenshire, Theramore Isle and outside the Shademore Inn, only has a male human model.

It is also odd that the Brigade only has human representation when the Gilneas Brigade was explicitly comprised of both humans and dwarves in Warcraft III, the latter of which being explained in Turtle WoW through the city of Gelnor mentioned in lore books in Gilneas (the city itself currently isn't visible in Turtle WoW).

**Steps to reproduce the behavior with as much detail as possible:**

1. Find a Brigade Footman in one of the following locations: Ravenshire or the Shademore Inn in Gilneas, or Theramore Isle in Dustwallow Marsh.

**Expected behavior. Describe how it should work:**
Like with all other human guards portrayed in-game including their militia counterparts in the Ravenshire Guards, they should likely have a female variant unit. Furthermore, being accurate to their portrayal in Warcraft III and through the lore established in Turtle WoW, there should likely be dwarven models attached to the same unit or dwarven units of the Gilneas Brigade present in the same locations.

To be clear about our bug vs feature policy:

If the issue is a mistake of Blizzard, it will need a forum suggestion post to change, as these are often debatable feature/bugs. In this post, I am under the impression that the commander inbalance is like that in 1.5 AV.

If the issue is a mistake of TWoW, and it affects game balance, we'll need a forum suggestion post to change. In this post, the added backdoors for alliance to get into the horde base. Some could argue that it balances out the 1.12 bug of horde -> alliance base backdoor.

title: Den Mother's next-melee spell Ravage allows it to melee and stun from infinite range
body:
**Please, provide a clear description what the bug is:**

Ravage is a "Next Melee" (like Heroic Strike) mob spell that stuns on hit. The issue with Den Mother's Ravage is that it works at a seemingly infinite range, allowing it to stun from a distance and making the fight exceedingly challenging for ranged classes that are unable to properly kite, and get their spells interrupted from afar from a high damage attack (30+ dmg on leather). This causes Den Mother to have an exceptionally high kill count : the hill leading to her den is littered with corpses and lvl 20+ HC graves. I myself killed her with just 15 health remaining: it almost caused me to lose my HC run.

**Steps to reproduce the behavior with as much detail as possible:**

1. Aggro Den Mother and try to kite her
2. Observe that her Ravage hits you from afar.
3. Compare with other mobs that have Ravage, like the nearby Thistle Bears ( https://www.wowhead.com/classic/npc=2163/thistle-bear ) : their Ravage only hits in melee.

**IDs of affected creatures, items, quests or spells with a link to the relevant page:**

This references a previously closed and unresolved issue: https://github.com/slowtorta/turtlewow-bug-tracker/issues/4497#issue-1925379014

**Please, provide a clear description what the bug is:**
Equipping multiple pieces of gear with the Vampirism stat does not increase the percentage healed.

Calculations were done using real health numbers.

Test 1 :
1x Darkmoon Ring Equipped (2% total)
Mele Swing for 309, health goes from 3432 to 3438. Expected heal for 6, heals for 6 (2% healing as expected)

Test 2:
2x Darkmoon ring equipped (4% total)
Mele swing for 342, health goes from 3532 to 3538. Expected heal for 13, heals for 6 (only 2%, should be 4%)

Test 3:
2x Darkmoon + Vampirism Brace (5% total)
Mele swing for 332, health goes from 3632 to 3635 expected heal for 16, heals for 3 (1% total)


With the results from test 3, it seems different pieces of gear are overwriting vampirism in other gear slots, effectively nullifying vampirism on other pieces of gear.

That is all! Have a nice day to whoever reads this. :)

title: Ornate Bloodstone Dagger does not work with damage proc items.
body:
Since the Ornate Bloodstone Dagger shares the same text with Blade of Eternal Darkness it should be able to proc off of additional damage items such as Thunder Lizard's Hide, Incendosaur Set, Repaired Electro-Lantern, Ring of Electrical Binding.

However it does not.

I have tested it and the weapon seems to be working on spellcasts but not on these proc effects.

Testing:
Equip Bloodstone Dagger and a number of proc items. 
Attack Mob, see the procs applying but the mob never takes additional damage nor do you receive damage from the Dagger proc

Attack the same mob using a spell such as Wrath/Lightning Bolt/Frostbolt
See the dagger drain HP and apply additional damage.

comments.body: The issue happens because the item id is too high. It uses id 80757, but in the packet SMSG_INITIAL_SPELLS where item and spell cooldowns are sent, the spell and item id are sent as an uint16, that's a 16 bit unsigned integer with a maximum value of 65535. It is impossible to make the client show the cooldowns of items with id above 65535, because the number cannot be represented with only 16 bits. The only way to fix this item would be to change it's id to a lower number.

title: Karazhan - Lord Blackwald II can be bugged out by Server Restart/Crash
body:
**Please, provide a clear description what the bug is:**

Lord Blackwald II can be despawned due to a server restart/crash, potentially locking players out of completing the instance.

**Steps to reproduce the behavior with as much detail as possible:**

1. Kill Dark Rider Master to trigger Lord Blackwald II summon condition.
2. Server crashes or restarts
3. Lord Blackwald II has now despawned and the Dark Rider Master cannot be killed again to trigger the spawning. Thus locking the party out of clearing that boss as well as enabling Moroes (since you cannot kill all other bosses)

NOTE: If you experience this you can work around it if you have killed _no other bosses_. Have your party leave the instance, Drop group and reform under a new leader, then re-enter and all the trash will respawn, allowing you to kill the boss.
If you are locked to the instance already when this occurs you are reliant on GM assistance as you cannot respawn the needed mob.

title: Pathfinding in Southern Coast of Gilneas
body:
**Please, provide a clear description what the bug is:**
Mobs and Spells appear to have pathfinding issues at the southern coast where the Spitecrest Naga reside. 
Spells like Blink is unusable only blinking you an estimated 1 yard backwards which mostly happens due to invalid Pathfinding.
Mobs like the Spitecrest Naga, Spitecrest Netter, Spitecrest Murloc, and even a single spawn of Hollow Web Venomspitter that is bordering Hollow Web Cemetery and The Coast. All of these mobs within that listed area are unable to pathfind to any player unless the player itself is within melee. (The Mobs are unable to move) There is a high likely hood abilities like Charge and other mobility abilities will not be working either as intended.

**Steps to reproduce the behavior with as much detail as possible:**

1. Any ranged attack towards the listed creature.
2. First hit will hit as it is before its pathfinding starts tricking the game into thinking its possible. 
3. Game realizes it isn't possible and will proceed to evade any ranged attack.
3.1. Use Blink to notice it wont bring you forward.
4. Ranged Mobs like the Venomspitter can at times hit you via its spit but will evade while not casting unless fought in melee.

**IDs of affected creatures, items, quests or spells with a link to the relevant page:**

NPC: NOT POSSIBLE DUE TO DATABASE BEING DOWN
Item: NOT POSSIBLE DUE TO DATABASE BEING DOWN
Quest: NOT POSSIBLE DUE TO DATABASE BEING DOWN
Spell: NOT POSSIBLE DUE TO DATABASE BEING DOWN
Object: NOT POSSIBLE DUE TO DATABASE BEING DOWN

**Expected behavior. Describe how it should work:**
Blink should teleport the player foward 20 yards
Mobs should be able to pathfind to the player in question that has agro even if they are outside of their melee range.
Mobs should be able to move. 


NOTE: This has only so far been tested in the southern coast near Hollow Web Woods and Hollow Web Cemetery. Other Southern Coasts are yet to be checked.

title: Gnomish Mind Control Cap
body:
**Please, provide a clear description what the bug is:**
On Classic and also in Vanilla when you had mind controlled your opponent they would cast abilitys, buff you, cast spells on the enemy (related to their class, so for example a shadow priest casted shadow spells but a holy priest smite etc...)
On T-wow the mind control effect only functions like a brainless pet that autohits (no matter which class you mind control)

**Steps to reproduce the behavior with as much detail as possible:**

1. Wear [Gnomish Mind Control Cap]
2.  Mind control an opponent.
3. Make them attack something.

**IDs of affected creatures, items, quests or spells with a link to the relevant page:**

NPC: https://database.turtle-wow.org/?npc=
Item: https://database.turtle-wow.org/?item=10726
Quest: https://database.turtle-wow.org/?quest=
Spell: https://database.turtle-wow.org/?spell=
Object: https://database.turtle-wow.org/?object=

**Expected behavior. Describe how it should work:**
The mind controlled target should cast spells/abilitys on you (like buffs) and damaging spells/abilitys on the target you make them attack.
Example 1: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=T-7oB-UVfE8
Example 2: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=j20aDN5zyew


> Is not like Priest mind control, you cannot use it to throw people off cliffs, zepplins, or into lava.
> 
> It turns the target into your pet for 20s, or turns you into their pet for 20s.  So far the backfire rate is pretty low, not worse than 1 in 4 I think. 
> 
> Even if it backfires against a player, they probably won't know how to take advantage of it, and you're on their side at that point, so worse case you're immune to their attacks for 20s (and immobilized).
> 
> On success (or failure) the one mind controlled target will turn into a pet just like a hunter's pet.  They will run over to the side of the controller.
> 
> You get a pet bar for them that's exactly like a hunter pet bar.  You can click a target and send them to attack it.  You get a small number (3-4?) skills that you can tell them to use but only if the target is an NPC, if it is a player it will automatically cast random spells from their class. 
> 
> Because you only get 20s to look at the abilities and you can only do it once per 30m, it takes a while to learn how to use it.  Generally you just target an enemy mob and hit the pet attack button.  You're free to take other actions while the 20 seconds of effect is running, so you can just "fire and forget".
> 
> You can target a faraway mob as a way of getting rid of the controlled mob for the time it will take them to run back after it wears off.  They follow normal pet pathing to get where you send them.
> 
> I just used this twice against a pair of horde who were camping out corpses today.  MCed the lvl 60 priest and sent him to kill his level 51 friend.

comments.body:
I know it's been closed, but I had a thought during the day that would allow keeping the ritual cutscene as it is and solve the bulk of the issue: simply add a second NPC related to the quest who handles the ritual. Ralathius still gives and completes the quest "Into the Dream V", but instead directs you to his compatriot, who will have the dialogue option to perform the ritual moved to him.

This second NPC will lock down as usual to allow the ritual cutscene to take place, allowing to maintain the cinematic and narrative piece as intended, but won't lock down Ralathius, allowing other people to pick up and turn in other parts of the attunement questline to him without issue.

This would, however, still cause a measure of bottlenecking, but it's nowhere near as disruptive as it is by having Ralathius do it. Ralathius is involved in some way or another with all six parts of Into the Dream, so tying a mechanic like this to him with even only a single quest was extremely impractical. However, it is a good piece of cinematic and narrative important to the story behind the Emerald Sanctum, so I think that it's worth keeping the ritual being an important part of the quest.

Just... maybe not make the main NPC lock down entirely while it's underway.

title: Emerald Blessing Tooltip Missing Info
body:
**Please, provide a clear description what the bug is:**
Emerald Blessing spell tooltip is inconsistent with other buffs. It does not list the buff duration on the spell tooltip.

**IDs of affected creatures, items, quests or spells with a link to the relevant page:**

Emerald Blessing druid spell (can't link DB page currently as its private)

**Expected behavior. Describe how it should work:**
All other class buffs, druid or otherwise, always state the duration of the effect. It is usually written at the end of the tooltip, although there are exceptions such as paladin seals.

If the duration is stated in the same sentence as the effects of the spell, it is written as "...for 1 hour." (e.g. Gift of the Wild, Arcane Brilliance, Prayer of Fortitude)
If the duration is stated in a new sentence after the effects of the spell, it is written as ". Lasts for 30 min." (e.g. Thorns, Amplify Magic, Trueshot Aura)

This seems to be a consistent naming convention for all class spells with a set duration. It would be good to stay in line with conventions for player comprehension and overall cohesiveness.

title: Other: Whisper level requirement
body:
As the population increased, the minimum character level required to whisper others was set to 5, probably to reduce the spam from bad actors.
Unfortunately, this restriction is present even if the account is old and has high level characters on it, which seems like an oversight.
It seems reasonable to be able to whisper at level 1 if there are high level characters on the same account.
In my case, I have multiple lv50+ characters, and the account is over a year old, but I'm still unable to whisper on a new character until level 5.
In contrast, global channels, such as /world, can be used even at level 1, at least on my account.

title: [Wrath of Cenarius] proc rate%
body:
I am an Elemental Shaman and was happy to get [Wrath of Cenarius] ring. But, after doing some testing, to be specific - I was hitting Target Dummy in OG with Rank 1 Lightning Bolt so my 6k mana pool would go down slower, I didnt get any proc at all. However, there was an Enhancement shammy next to me, equipped with the same ring, geared on elemental procs (items that give 1-5 elemental dmg on melee hit), and he had 100% uptime from [Wrath of Cenarius]. 
Another class is Warlock, who benefits from that ring. All warlocks have DoT abilities and said that each DoT has a chance to proc [Wrath of Cenarius] ring and its pretty decent for them. Especially if you are going with SM/RUIN build.

So, my questions would be:

1. Does it or does it not proc from casting spells?
2. Does it proc only from melee spell hit such as described above.
3. Does it proc only from DoTs?
4. Why proc% is so misarable? Item is really hard to get and I am really disappointed with it.

Could you please explain this? I dont understand why it cant proc more often, and if you think thats too OP (which is not) add some internal CD on procs. For example, make proc rate super high (or just higher that it is right now), but it can proc once in 30s-60s. Something like a trinket usage. 

Looking forward to hearing from you.

title: The new consumables use duplicated spell visual+spell icon that cause problems with aura stacking
body:
**Please, provide a clear description what the bug is:**
The applied buff of the new elixirs, Dreamtonic and Dreamshard Elixir, uses the same spell icon as existing elixirs which causes problems with stacking them.

**Steps to reproduce the behavior with as much detail as possible:**

1. Drink one of the new elixirs/potions
2. Look at the buff icon of that elixir/potion
3. Try to drink another elixir/potion that shares the same spell icon
4. Find that the two effects won't stack with each other
5. In addition to that, it makes the two buffs indistinguishable to addons for the purpose of tracking buffs on yourself and allies.

**IDs of affected creatures, items, quests or spells with a link to the relevant page:**


Spell:
https://database.turtle-wow.org/?spell=45489 Dreamtonic which shares spell icon with Arcane Elixir
https://database.turtle-wow.org/?spell=45427 Dreamshard Elixir which shares spell icon with Greater Arcane Elixir

https://database.turtle-wow.org/?spell=45988 Elixir of Greater Nature Power (not yet implemented on live server, so it's untested but it's very likely to suffer the same issue so best be proactive). Shares spell icon with nature protection potion and greater nature protection potion

**Expected behavior. Describe how it should work:**
If you want two elixirs or potions to stack with each other, they must not have the same spell icon. If you want them to not stack with each other, they should still have different spell icons for clarity purposes.

This bug requires a client-side fix.

title: Bugged Shadeslayer Troll Drop Rates
body:
**Please, provide a clear description what the bug is:**

Shadeslayer trolls (the new elite troll area in Mt. Hyjal) are the most difficult elites in the zone, and have a single repeatable quest demanding 10 bracelets from them. The bracelets drop extremely infrequently and they don't share across all 5 party members, unlike every other quest in Hyjal (notably the easier furbolgs).

**Steps to reproduce the behavior with as much detail as possible:**

1. Pick up the quest for Shadeslayer Bracelets.
2. Mow down hundreds of elite trolls in a group of 5 players.
3. After half an hour, you will have 0-1 on most of the group, and perhaps 3 on a lucky person.

**IDs of affected creatures, items, quests or spells with a link to the relevant page:**

NPC: Various Shadeslayer npcs in west Mt. Hyjal.
Item: Shadeslayer Bracelet

**Expected behavior. Describe how it should work:**

Nearly every other quest in Hyjal is can be grouped for, regardless of elite or non-elite quest. Notably, the furbolg pendant quest from the elite Barkskin Hold will drop a pendant for all 5 group members from a body. The Barkskin are much easier than Shadeslayer trolls, which have a wide variety of spammable CC, heals, and come in mostly elite form unlike the furbolgs. After spending nearly 40 minutes with a Naxx-geared 5man we had a total of 7 bracelets spread across 5 people, and we needed 50 bracelets total. The quest, and presumably the follow-up repeatable quest (I'm guessing it becomes a repeatable afterwards) should function like the rest of Mt. Hyjal.

title: Blacktooth Grin guild base in Stonard is missing guards and npcs after 1.17x update
body:
**Please, provide a clear description what the bug is:**
Blacktooth Grin guild base lost its NPCs like the last major content update in Swamp of Sorrows. Guards, vendors, etc are removed, though the base still stands. Have confirmed other guild bases have not suffered this issue. Blackwing Guard for instance has their NPCs.

**Steps to reproduce the behavior with as much detail as possible:**

1. Go to Stonard, travel over to Blacktooth camp.
2. Peer around and see NPCs, guards, vendors missing from camp.

**NPCs missing from center tent:**
![image](https://github.com/slowtorta/turtlewow-bug-tracker/assets/110629519/0eb2e58b-65d8-4732-8758-f43f3bb4d6f8)

Blacktooth tabard guards missing from the line to the outhouses:
![image](https://github.com/slowtorta/turtlewow-bug-tracker/assets/110629519/675b41cf-ee5f-412a-ba50-7c6585f6b2e4)

Harold our green haired gnome vendor is missing from his tent:
![image](https://github.com/slowtorta/turtlewow-bug-tracker/assets/110629519/7ba4bb72-61bb-47f4-b5f0-91493e1286a0)

The guards appear to have been kidnapped which had our tabards outside of each doorway:
![image](https://github.com/slowtorta/turtlewow-bug-tracker/assets/110629519/df8fe801-375a-4787-867e-e43ee86f4ae3)

(just some samples, there's obviously more npcs missing)

**IDs of affected creatures, items, quests or spells with a link to the relevant page:**
The database is not available at the moment. A GM recovered our npcs in guild base last time though. I'll avoid naming them here, can share who via other means.

**Expected behavior. Describe how it should work:**
Here's screenshots where we had npcs before 1.17 update:
![image](https://github.com/slowtorta/turtlewow-bug-tracker/assets/110629519/2b47d415-f78c-4a3f-8474-fc0a0ea500d5)

![image](https://github.com/slowtorta/turtlewow-bug-tracker/assets/110629519/2ff10809-7e28-4f2b-9eeb-345cec962fa6)

![image](https://github.com/slowtorta/turtlewow-bug-tracker/assets/110629519/b5193985-c457-41a9-a71c-87927ca2f12e)

**Theory for resolution:**
Well I think what's going on here is that NPCs were spawned into the world, not into the dev build pipeline world upstream. This is the second major content update which nukes just our npcs/vendors and the like but not the entire base. 
Because it's not impacting other guild bases, I believe our npcs were spawned in by GM and need to be added upstream into dev side like Blackwing Guard's are. 

A GM fixed this last time via a ticket and I believe the time before.

title: Ornate Bloodstone Dagger on Druid
body:
Ornate Bloodstone Dagger

Equip: Your landing damaging spells have a chance on sacrificing 250 of your health and dealing 250 Fire damage.

On druid, the dagger doesn't do damage to the target. As a matter of fact, the dagger instead only works when a druid changes forms and it takes 500 fire damage, meaning I believe both parts of the weapon effect, the sacrifice HP effect and the fire damage part, assuming the spell (Shapeshift) counts as the druid being the target of the spell.

**Steps to reproduce the behavior with as much detail as possible:**

Equip Ornate Bloodstone Dagger with the "Elemental Cat Build", which requires the following items: Incendosaur Skin Set (Gloves, Boots, Shoulders), Repaired Electro-Lantern. These are the core items, you can also equip Blazefury Medallion (Kazzak) and Hide of the Thunder Lizard (H) but are not a must. Use the dagger in main hand and test on any target. Checking combat log will show that the dagger is not procing on the target

1. Equip Ornate Bloodstone Dagger with the "Elemental Cat Build", which requires the following items: Incendosaur Skin Set (Gloves, Boots, Shoulders), Repaired Electro-Lantern. These are the core items, you can also equip Blazefury Medallion (Kazzak) and Hide of the Thunder Lizard (H) but are not a must.
2. Use the dagger in main hand and test on any target with melee attacks. Checking combat log will show that the dagger is not procing on the target, even tho the spell damage landed by the item procs does.  Spells WILL NOT proc the dagger effect either (Moonfire, Wrath, Starfire, Insect Swarm).
3. Using Shapeshift abilities will make the druid take 500 damage from the dagger, both the sacrifice part of the dagger and the damage part, all taken as fire damage.

Judging that Ornate Bloodstone Dagger has the same wording and effect as Blade of Eternal Darkness (Equip: Chance on landing a damaging spell to deal 100 Shadow damage and restore 100 mana to you), I would assume they should work close to the same extent. Even if it's not working with the "Elemental Cat" build, the dagger itself IT's NOT procing on spells either. I only tested on a druid, not sure if other classes have the same issues.

**IDs of affected creatures, items, quests or spells with a link to the relevant page:**

At this given moment we are not allowed to check Turtle WoW Database, as such I cannot provide any links (or at least I as a user cannot).

**Expected behavior. Describe how it should work:**

Not having this item before it's a bit tricky to specify this, but if we are to take Blade of Eternal Darkness as an example, given they have the same wording, when you're attacking in shapeshift form using the stated gear from earlier, there should be a chance, when the spell damage provided by the items occur a proc on melee damage dealt (auto attacks, shred, claw) those magic damage procs SHOULD have a chance to proc the dagger effect. The dagger effect being sacrificing 250 of the playable character HP (most probably intended as fire damage, working as a form of life tap if you would) and dealing 250 fire damage to the target to which you had dealt the magic damage to. 

If further materials are needed to fix this issues I will be happy to procure such materials.

Thank you for your time, love the new patch, hope to see this issue fixed soon, I believe in the Dev Team <3

title: Aqual Quintessence unusable when Eternal Quintessence on cooldown
body:
If you use your Aqual Quintessence and your Eternal Quintessence, then go pick up another Aqual Quintessence it will remain unusable until the Eternal Quintessence comes off cooldown. There is no cd indication on Aqual Quintessence, and they are not supposed to share a cooldown.

Steps to reproduce the behavior with as much detail as possible:

    Use Aqual Quintessence and Eternal Quintessence to douse two runes in molten core
    Pick up another Aqual Quintessence and attempt to douse another rune
    It will remain unusable and giving you a spell not ready yet error until the Eternal Quintessence cooldown is up

Aqual Quintessence and Eternal Quintessence is not supposed to share a cooldown.

title: Scarshield Warlock behavior in LBRS
body:
Currently the [Scarshield Warlocks](https://database.turtle-wow.org/?npc=9257) in LBRS aren't using their [Scarshield Portal](https://database.turtle-wow.org/?spell=15125) ability correctly.

When fighting these mobs, they will initially cast the ability as intended though the moment the mob is killed the [Scarshield Portal](https://database.turtle-wow.org/?spell=15125) will despawn. The correct behaviour should be that if they're allowed to fully cast the [Scarshield Portal](https://database.turtle-wow.org/?spell=15125), it should persist even if the [Scarshield Warlock](https://database.turtle-wow.org/?npc=9257) is killed.

Due to the current behaviour, in my experience the portals have always despawned too quickly to test if they have any other behaviour, however under normal circumstances the portal should randomly spawn several [Burning Imps](https://database.turtle-wow.org/?npc=9708), [Burning Felhounds](https://database.turtle-wow.org/?npc=10261) and much more rarely a [Burning Felguard ](https://database.turtle-wow.org/?npc=10263) rarespawn once the [Scarshield Portal](https://database.turtle-wow.org/?spell=15125) has finished it's 30 second duration.

title: Attack Power reduction effects from Screech and Demoralizing Shout do not stack
body:
**Please, provide a clear description what the bug is:**
Screech used by Owl/Bat pets does not stack with Warrior's Demoralizing Shout. Both debuffs are active on the target, but only the stronger one applies the Attack Power reduction. It doesn't matter whether Screech or Demoralizing Shout is applied first, the outcome is the same.
[Video](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5AzvGM3UcDE)

**Steps to reproduce the behavior with as much detail as possible:**
1. Engage an enemy with high enough AP for testing purposes
2. Use Demoralizing Shout
3. Demoralizing Shout will be active on the target and its Attack Power correctly reduced
4. Use Screech
5. Screech will be active on the target, Demoralizing shout will remain active on the target, but target Attack Power will remain unchanged compared to step 3

**IDs of affected creatures, items, quests or spells with a link to the relevant page:**
Screech (Rank 4): https://database.turtle-wow.org/?spell=24579
Demoralizing Shout (Rank 5): https://database.turtle-wow.org/?spell=11556
Both spells apply the effect `(6) Apply Aura #99: Mod Attack Power`

**Expected behavior. Describe how it should work:**
Screech Attack Power reduction should stack with effects such as Demoralizing Shout or Demoralizing Roar.

title: Bloodsail Buccaneers Reputation / Exalted Impossible.
body:
**Please, provide a clear description what the bug is:**
The Devs have added alot of new quests and some more reputation items for this rep, rewards for hitting Revered and Exalted. 

The problem is, the quests only get you so far into honored after doing them all, I farmed Bruisers in Booty Bay for a 5-6 hours to get to Revered after doing all the quests. 

This is when the crazy part happens, they stop giving you rep once you hit Revered, and the only way to get to Exalted is to farm a vendor in Badlands for 5 rep per 5 minutes. 

Now if you ran in blind as I did and did all the quests first which give around 15k Rep, then you have to grind 21000 rep on this Badlands NPC, at 5 Rep per kill you need to kill this NPC 4200 times, on a 5 minute respawn timer, realistically this is like 4 weeks farming the only vendor in the badlands for Alliance. Even if you saved the quests for Revered you still need to kill the vendor 1200 times.

This is Very bad game design and I got up to 1000 rep before I got reported to the GM's for griefing NPC's. Which is fine, I agree this is not good. 

So all I'm asking is please let us grind to exalted Bloodsail Buccaneers Reputation by killing the Bruisers in Booty Bay, by enabled their rep gain up to exalted. Would still be a good grind but it doesn't inconvenience anyone killing guards unlike a vendor 4200 times. 

You've even added rep rewards for exalted albeit rubbish ones, but this doesn't matter for completionists / exalted rep chasers, so you must intend people to get exalted, but the only way is through griefing a vendor for weeks. 

TL:DR
Enable Bloodsail Buccaneers rep gain up until exalted from Booty Bay Bruisers, the only alternative is killing a vendor in Badlands 4200 times that people use alot and being told by the GM's to stop, making this rep grind Impossible.

title: When switching roles, there is a disconnection, and it requires a requeue.
body:
Lately, when facing long queues, there is a chance of getting disconnected when switching roles on the same account. In the past three days, I've encountered this issue three times. However, this type of disconnection doesn't grant the 5-minute queue grace period; instead, it requires a complete requeue. After waiting for hours to get online, changing roles means having to queue for several more hours, which is very unfriendly.

**Describe in as much detail as possible the steps to reproduce the behaviour:** 1.
1. Returning to the role list (at this point, there is a possibility of getting stuck or disconnected directly with a message stating 'disconnected from the server.' I have encountered this issue twice)
2. Returning to the role list (without getting disconnected), selecting another role to enter the game, after the loading screen, getting disconnected with a message stating 'disconnected from the server.' I have encountered this issue once).

** Expected behaviour. Describe how it should work: ****
Should not experience disconnection, or if a disconnection occurs, there should be a 5-minute window to log back in without the need to requeue.

title: Cheating Player "Chinacapf"
body:
Hello, I'm making a report regarding what I believe is a player using exploits to gain an unfair advantage. While I was in the Swamp of Sorrows on my warlock (Grimbatuul) I attacked a flagged level 40 male night elf warrior named "Chinacapf". He had about 2.3k hp. 

For reference, I have a level 60 character with raid gear. He was fully dotted, hit with several shadowbolts, death coil, and a shadowburn. He took damage well in excess of his current or maximum health, but refused to die. His health appears to reach a minimum of 93, and would not go any lower, regardless of what I hit him with. The combat log registered him as taking the damage, no resists or immunity, it just didn't touch his health bar. I also had no trouble killing flagged players in the same zone immediately before and after, and don't believe it was an issue with the server. 

A level 49 undead rogue named Pup was also there contributing damage, and can attest to what happened. I also believe the player was hardcore, as he was in the <HY> guild. I would appreciate if action could be taken to deal with a player using an invulnerability cheat, thank you.

title: Juvenile Snow Leopard Has Overtuned Damage Output
body:
**Description**

Juvenile Snow Leopards in Dun Morogh have extremely high damage values for their level, more resembling something around the mid teens. This is true of both the level 5 and 6 variants. On a level 6 Warrior with maxed defense skill and 224 armor granting 19.8% damage reduction, level 5 Juvenile Snow Leopards were landing 10-17 damage white hits. 

![image](https://github.com/slowtorta/turtlewow-bug-tracker/assets/27025095/a540b8e1-2392-46aa-8c45-df4bb9582609)

For comparison, nearby level 6 Young Black Bears were white hitting for 6-8 damage. This is a lot worse than it sounds when you consider these cat mobs have a fast swing timer and bears have a much slower one. This damage disparity is even directly referenced on the database. Here are some other "cat" mobs for comparison:

Juvenile Snow Leopard (Levels 5-6): Damage: 13 - 22
Nightsaber (Levels 5-6): Damage: 4 - 6
Feral Nightsaber (Levels 10-11): Damage: 11 - 14
Savannah Prowler (Levels 14-15) Damage: 14 - 19

**Steps to reproduce the behavior with as much detail as possible:**

1. Aggro Juvenile Snow Leopards
2. Observe that they hit much harder than similarly leveled enemies in the area.

**IDs of affected creatures, items, quests or spells with a link to the relevant page:**

Affected NPC's: 
Juvenile Snow Leopard: https://database.turtle-wow.org/?npc=1199

Other non-bugged NPC's for comparison:
Nightsaber: https://database.turtle-wow.org/?npc=2042
Feral Nightsaber: https://database.turtle-wow.org/?npc=2034
Savannah Prowler: https://database.turtle-wow.org/?npc=3425

**Expected behavior. Describe how it should work:**

Juvenile Snow Leopards should have a damage value resembling the level 5-6 Nightsabers of around 4-6. They should not hit as hard as a level 14 mob in the Barrens.

title: Dashel Stonefist does not turn hostile: The Missing Diplomat
body:
**Please, provide a clear description what the bug is:**
On the quest "The Missing Diplomat" in the section where you have to fight Dashel Stonefist, an error occurred that I have honestly never seen before. I will elaborate ...

Context: Normal Mode (not HC mode)

The quest initiates just fine, you talk to Dashel Stonefist and he summons his two thugs and starts attacking you. However, when I right clicked Dashel Stonefist, a "talking animation" like when you talk to any other npc displayed and no attack by my character was performed. Just to be extra clear, this happened while Dashel Stonefist and his thugs were already attacking and the fight was well underway.

Right clicking again (while they are attacking and the fight started) only displayed another talking animation.
I had to run away to abort the quest. Then I aborted the quest by deleting it from my quest log. And then I accepted it again.

The first thing I did is try again to exclude any random flaking out of various scripts but I could reliably reproduce the exact bug.

The next thing I did is re-log. And then try again (orderly aborting the quest, deleting it form the quest log and launching it again). However, I could reproduce the exact bug reliably.

The next thing I did is re-log, delete the WDB folder and then try again (again, orderly aborting the quest, deleting it from the quest log and launching it again). However, I could reproduce the exact bug reliably.

Upon right clicking Dashel Stonefist once the fight started and he summons his thugs and starts attacking a talking animation displayed. And even waiting a little while and letting him attack does not change this. I could wait for half a minute or even a minute, right clicking him during the fight (when you are supposed to fight back) always displayed a talking animation. I suspect that this happened because the npc did not turn hostile (as can be seen by the name plate of the npc remaining yellow instead of turning red) even though the npc was attacking my character.

I was in the end able to complete the quest by activating an ability (crusader strike) on the npc Dashel Stonefist. That turned him hostile (as could be seen by his name plate changing from yellow to red) and then I could properly right click him to attack him and complete the quest.

I have never seen this kind of bug before, it happened only today. I ran the quest on other character just fine, I do not know why it happened like this.

I suspect that it happened because the npc for some reason did not turn hostile when the npc starts attacking. Its name plate remained yellow (as opposed to turning red) even during the fight while the npc and his thugs are attacking. I was advised to report my findings here (even if it turns out that it might not be a bug and perhaps latency related) so I am filing this report.

I wonder if the npc did not reset properly somehow between interactions.
It could also be internet latency related (this bug occurred when the server was under extreme load).
Lastly it could have been caused by players being nearby and possibly attempting to run the quest (I am mentioning this because other players were in the vicinity standing in front of the npc.)



_On an unrelated note, is this quest supposed to pvp-flag players? I am asking because the quest force-flags players to pvp. I thought that quests like this were changed to no longer force-flag people to prevent HC griefing._

**Steps to reproduce the behavior with as much detail as possible:**

1. Initiate the quest "The Missing Diplomat" by talking to Dashel Stonefist and accepting the quest where you have to fight and defeat him.
2. When the fight starts and he summons his thugs attempt to right click Dashel Stonefist with your cursor
3. Observe as, instead of attacking, a talking animation displays by your character

**IDs of affected creatures, items, quests or spells with a link to the relevant page:**

NPC: https://database.turtle-wow.org/?npc=4961
Quest: https://database.turtle-wow.org/?quest=1447

**Expected behavior. Describe how it should work:**
The npc Dashel Stonefist should be hostile and right-clickable once the fight starts and he summons his thugs. It worked that way any other time I ran the quest so I don't know why it literally bugged out this time. Maybe it was serverload/latency, or maybe it was a freak accident. Either way, here is the full report, I hope it helps.
